sentences.english: At one point, she even yells for the police to shoot the chimp to stop the attack.
sentences.chinese: 有一次，她甚至大叫着让警察向黑猩猩射击，以便阻止他的攻击。

sentences.chinese: 他偶然发现了一个450万年前的有袋动物的颌骨。

sentences.english: an astonishing decision
sentences.chinese: 令人惊讶的决定

sentences.english: their astonishing success
sentences.chinese: 他们惊人的成功

detailed_translations.english: so surprising that it is difficult to believe

sentences.english: By a fortunate coincidence, a passer-by heard her cries for help.
sentences.chinese: 所幸正巧有个过路人听到了她的呼救。

detailed_translations.chinese: 幸运的；侥幸的；吉祥的；带来幸运的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is fortunate has something good happen to them, or is in a good situation

sentences.english: Unfortunately, you were out when we called.
sentences.chinese: 很遗憾，我们来的时候你出去了。

detailed_translations.english: used when you are mentioning a fact that you wish was not true

sentences.english: An independent study found that the owners are not as badly off as they say, and most are making money.
sentences.chinese: 一项独立的研究发现，企业主们并不像他们说的那么经济困难，大部分都在赚钱。

sentences.english: The school is rather badly off for equipment.
sentences.chinese: 学校相当缺乏设备。

detailed_translations.english: not having much money

sentences.english: Most people who smoke began smoking in their teens.
sentences.chinese: 大多数吸烟的人都是在十几岁时开始吸的。

detailed_translations.english: If you are a teen in your teens, you are between thirteen and nineteen years old. Teen is informal for teenager.

sentences.english: It’s just an ordinary camera.
sentences.chinese: 这只是普通的相机。

sentences.english: The book is about ordinary people.
sentences.chinese: 这本书描写的是普通人。

sentences.english: Art should be part of ordinary life.
sentences.chinese: 艺术应该是日常生活的一部分。

sentences.english: It is good because it is written in friendly, ordinary language.
sentences.chinese: 它很不错，因为它是用平易近人的日常语言写的。

detailed_translations.english: average, common, or usual, not different or special

sentences.english: He was easily bored.
sentences.chinese: 他很容易感到厌烦。

sentences.english: After a while, I got bored and left.
sentences.chinese: 过了一会儿，我觉得无聊，就走了。

detailed_translations.english: tired and impatient because you do not think something is interesting, or because you have nothing to do

sentences.english: The pictures are similar, but there are subtle differences between them.
sentences.chinese: 这些图片很相似，但它们之间有细微的差别。

sentences.english: The warning signs of the disease are so subtle that they are often ignored.
sentences.chinese: 这种疾病的警示征兆不易察觉，因而往往被忽视。

sentences.english: a subtle form of racism
sentences.chinese: 隐性的种族歧视

sentences.english: The dish had a subtle hint of ginger.
sentences.chinese: 这道菜微微带点姜的味道。

detailed_translations.english: not easy to notice or understand unless you pay careful attention

sentences.english: A museum should aim to entertain as well as educate.
sentences.chinese: 博物馆应该致力于成为娱乐和教育功能并重的场所。

sentences.english: Mark usually does the cooking when we entertain.
sentences.chinese: 我们招待客人时通常都是马克下厨。

sentences.english: Do you get an allowance for entertaining clients?
sentences.chinese: 你招待客户有补助吗？

detailed_translations.english: to amuse or interest people in a way that gives them pleasure

sentences.english: Children’s TV nowadays is much more entertaining.
sentences.chinese: 如今的儿童电视节目要比过去有趣多了。

sentences.english: an entertaining evening
sentences.chinese: 令人愉快的夜晚

detailed_translations.english: amusing and interesting

sentences.english: a charming little Italian restaurant
sentences.chinese: 一家有吸引力的意大利小餐厅

sentences.english: Harry can be very charming.
sentences.chinese: 哈里有时候很讨人喜欢。

detailed_translations.english: very pleasing or attractive

sentences.english: I met a tramp and gave him some money on my way home.
sentences.chinese: 我回家的路上碰到了一个流浪汉并给了他一些钱。

sentences.english: Five minutes inside the soup-kitchen in Hackney, east London, and I immediately understand what Orwell meant - that the "typical tramp" does not exist.
sentences.chinese: 在伦敦东面哈克尼的汤棚里呆了五分钟，我立刻明白了奥威尔那句“‘典型的流浪汉’不存在”是什么意思。

sentences.english: A tramp does not see such a meal twice in the year, in the spike or out of it.
sentences.chinese: 对于一个流浪汉而言，不论是在收容站还是在外面，如此丰盛的饭食他是见不到第二次的。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has no home or job and moves from place to place, often asking for food or money

name: throughout
trans: 遍及；在…各处；在整个期间，自始至终

sentences.english: a large organization with offices throughout the world
sentences.chinese: 在世界各地都设有办事处的一家大型机构

sentences.english: The disease spread rapidly throughout Europe.
sentences.chinese: 疾病迅速在整个欧洲蔓延开来。

sentences.english: The house is in excellent condition, with fitted carpets throughout.
sentences.chinese: 这幢房子状况极好，全部铺着地毯。

sentences.english: We are open every weekend throughout the year.
sentences.chinese: 我们全年每个周末都对外开放。

detailed_translations.english: in every part of a particular area, place etc
during all of a particular period, from the beginning to the end

sentences.english: Thousands of people have been made homeless .
sentences.chinese: 成千上万人被逼得无家可归。

detailed_translations.english: without a home

sentences.english: He’s shaved off his moustache.
sentences.chinese: 他剃去了小胡子。

detailed_translations.english: hair that grows on a man’s upper lip

sentences.english: a worn patch on the carpet
sentences.chinese: 地毯上一小块磨破的地方

sentences.english: well worn stone steps
sentences.chinese: 残破的石阶

detailed_translations.english: a worn object is old and damaged, especially because it has been used a lot

detailed_translations.chinese: 穿；磨损（wear的过去分词）；佩戴

sentences.english: Car buyers tend to replace worn-out tyres with the same brand.
sentences.chinese: 汽车的买主们倾向于用同一品牌的轮胎更换废旧轮胎。

detailed_translations.english: Something that is worn out is so old, damaged, or thin from use that it cannot be used anymore

sentences.english: They greeted each other stiffly, without affection.
sentences.chinese: 他们生硬地打着招呼，没有一丝爱意。

sentences.english: Successful people often aren’t very good at dealing with failure.
sentences.chinese: 一帆风顺的人往往不太擅长应对失败。

sentences.english: I always felt a bit of a failure at school.
sentences.chinese: 我上学时总觉得自己有点失败。

detailed_translations.english: a lack of success in achieving or doing something

sentences.english: There are grounds for cautious optimism.
sentences.chinese: 有理由保持谨慎乐观。

detailed_translations.english: a tendency to believe that good things will always happen

sentences.english: He struggled to overcome his shyness.
sentences.chinese: 他努力克服自己的羞怯。

sentences.english: Her financial problems could no longer be overcome.
sentences.chinese: 她的经济困难再也无法解决。

sentences.english: Australia overcame the Netherlands 2-1.
sentences.chinese: 澳大利亚队2比1战胜了荷兰队。

detailed_translations.english: to successfully control a feeling or problem that prevents you from achieving something

name: underdog
trans: 失败者；处于劣势的一方

sentences.english: Crowds often feel sympathy for the underdog.
sentences.chinese: 观众经常会同情弱者。

detailed_translations.chinese: 比赛中不被看好者；失败者；受压迫者；斗败了的狗

sentences.english: The snowstorm added to our difficulties.
sentences.chinese: 暴风雪增加了我们的困难。

sentences.english: From beneath, it was at times like gazing into a snowstorm. It was hard not to think of souls.
sentences.chinese: 从下面往上看时，就像在暴风雪中抬头看到的一样，让人不禁想起了逝去的那些亡灵。

sentences.english: I step outside the house and nothing can stop me—the late season snowstorm, the puddle of standing water at the bottom of my porch steps that will never evaporate, the mud and muck this season brings.
sentences.chinese: 我踏出家门，没有任何事情能阻挡我——深冬季节的暴风雪、我家门廊台阶上那永远挥散不去的雨水坑，还有这个季节带来的烂泥和污秽。

detailed_translations.english: a storm with strong winds and a lot of snow

sentences.english: The inside of the bag was lined with soft leather.
sentences.chinese: 这包的里面衬了软皮。

sentences.english: elegant leather boots
sentences.chinese: 精美的皮靴

detailed_translations.english: animal skin that has been treated to preserve it, and is used for making shoes, bags etc

sentences.english: The detective picked out the words with difficulty.
sentences.chinese: 侦探费力地辨认出这些字。

sentences.english: I have been picked out to represent the whole team.
sentences.chinese: 我被挑选出来代表全队。

detailed_translations.english: If you pick out someone or something, you recognize them when it is difficult to see them, for example, because they are among a large group

sentences.english: a handkerchief trimmed with lace
sentences.chinese: 饰有蕾丝花边的手绢

sentences.english: lace curtains
sentences.chinese: 网眼窗帘

detailed_translations.chinese: 花边；鞋带；饰带；少量烈酒
detailed_translations.english: a fine cloth made with patterns of many very small holes

sentences.english: Mrs. Johnson cut off a generous piece of the meat.
sentences.chinese: 约翰逊太太切下一大块肉。

sentences.english: He threatened to cut my hair off.
sentences.chinese: 他威胁要剪掉我的头发。

detailed_translations.english: If you cut something off, you remove it with a knife or a similar tool

sentences.english: This meat’s so tough I can hardly chew it!
sentences.chinese: 这肉太老了，我几乎嚼不动！

detailed_translations.english: the act of biting something many times with your teeth
to bite food several times before swallowing it

sentences.english: She took a mouthful of water.
sentences.chinese: 她喝了一大口水。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of food or drink that you put into your mouth at one time

sentences.english: Acting has brought me enormous enjoyment.
sentences.chinese: 演戏给我带来莫大的快乐。

sentences.english: Unfortunately, a small minority want to spoil everyone else’s enjoyment.
sentences.chinese: 很遗憾，少数几个人想令其他所有人扫兴。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling of pleasure you get from having or doing something, or something you enjoy doing

sentences.english: Although I soon convinced him of my innocence, I think he still has serious doubts about my sanity.
sentences.chinese: 尽管我很快就使他相信我是清白的，但是他还是非常怀疑我精神是否正常。

detailed_translations.english: If someone or something convinces you of something, they make you believe that it is true or that it exists

sentences.english: convincing evidence of his guilt
sentences.chinese: 证明他有罪的有力证据

detailed_translations.english: making you believe that something is true or right

name: direct
trans: 直接的；笔直的；率直的，坦率的

sentences.english: Experienced users have direct access to the main data files.
sentences.chinese: 高级用户可直接浏览主数据文档。

sentences.english: I’m not in direct contact with them.
sentences.chinese: 我和他们没有直接的联系。

sentences.english: Few policy-makers have had direct experience of business.
sentences.chinese: 决策者几乎都没有直接的从商经历。

sentences.english: Women often feel men are too direct and not sympathetic enough.
sentences.chinese: 女人常常觉得男人太直率，不够体贴。

detailed_translations.english: done without any other people, actions, processes etc coming between

sentences.english: The previous year Adolphson had starred in a play in which Ingrid had been an extra.
sentences.chinese: 上个年度阿道夫森曾主演了一部戏，在该戏中英格丽德是临时演员。

sentences.english: The film won five Oscars.
sentences.chinese: 这部影片荣获五项奥斯卡奖。

detailed_translations.english: a prize that is given each year in the US for the best film, actor etc in the film industry. It is officially called an Academy Award.

sentences.english: an outstanding example of a 13th-century castle
sentences.chinese: 13世纪城堡的杰出典范

sentences.english: an outstanding success
sentences.chinese: 了不起的成功

sentences.english: His performance was outstanding.
sentences.chinese: 他的表演相当出色。

detailed_translations.chinese: 杰出的；显著的；未解决的；未偿付的
detailed_translations.english: extremely good

sentences.english: The River Rhine rises in Switzerland.
sentences.chinese: 莱茵河发源于瑞士。

sentences.english: But I did not need to go to Switzerland to learn that.
sentences.chinese: 到瑞士要是就为了知道这些就大可不必去了。

sentences.english: The banks needed to do something, so they turned themselves into the Switzerland of the Gulf.
sentences.chinese: 银行必须做点什么，于是它们把迪拜变成了波斯湾地区的瑞士。

sentences.english: I have never betrayed a confidence.
sentences.chinese: 我从未泄露过别人的秘密。

sentences.english: They spent their evenings drinking wine and sharing confidences.
sentences.chinese: 晚上他们就喝喝酒，说说知心话。

detailed_translations.english: a secret or a piece of information that is private or personal

sentences.english: the film’s lavish costumes and spectacular sets
sentences.chinese: 影片中奢华的戏装和壮观的场景

sentences.english: Hallowe’en costumes
sentences.chinese: 万圣节前夕化装服

detailed_translations.english: a set of clothes worn by an actor or by someone to make them look like something such as an animal, famous person etc

sentences.english: Jim raised his hands in a despairing gesture.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆举起双手，做出绝望的手势。

sentences.english: The Queen has now made a gesture towards public opinion.
sentences.chinese: 女王现在摆出了尊重民意的姿态。

detailed_translations.english: a movement of part of your body, especially your hands or head, to show what you mean or how you feel

sentences.english: In this particular case, no one else was involved.
sentences.chinese: 这件事没有其他人牵涉其中。

sentences.english: Most students choose one particular area for research.
sentences.chinese: 大多数学生选择一个特定领域进行研究。

sentences.english: Marty’s very particular about his food.
sentences.chinese: 马蒂对食物很挑剔。

detailed_translations.chinese: 特别的，特指的；讲究的；挑剔的，吹毛求疵的
detailed_translations.english: a particular thing or person is the one that you are talking about, and not any other

sentences.english: Steve was in a particularly bad mood when he got back.
sentences.chinese: 史蒂夫回来时情绪特别不好。

sentences.english: The restaurant is particularly popular with young people.
sentences.chinese: 那家餐厅尤其受到年轻人的欢迎。

sentences.english: We are hoping to expand our business, particularly in Europe.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望扩大业务，尤其是在欧洲。

sentences.english: British farmers, particularly those producing lamb, are very worried.
sentences.chinese: 英国农场主，尤其是养羊羔的农场主，非常担忧。

detailed_translations.english: more than usual or more than others

sentences.english: I’m saving this bottle of champagne for a special occasion.
sentences.chinese: 我要把这瓶香槟酒留到特别的日子喝。

sentences.english: She had met Zahid on two separate occasions.
sentences.chinese: 她遇到过扎希德两次。

sentences.english: This was the occasion for expressions of friendship by the two presidents.
sentences.chinese: 这是两位总统进行友好交流的时机。

detailed_translations.english: an important social event or ceremony

sentences.english: We’ll have to budget more carefully.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须更仔细地安排开支。

sentences.english: This scheme enables you to budget the cost through fixed monthly payments.
sentences.chinese: 这个计划可以让你把费用分摊在每个月里等额偿还。

sentences.english: Cheap flights are available from budget travel agents from $240.
sentences.chinese: 起价$240的廉价机票可从一些经济旅行社那里买到。

detailed_translations.english: to carefully plan and control how much money you spend and what you will buy with it

detailed_translations.chinese: 低廉的， 收费公道的
detailed_translations.english: Budget is used in advertising to suggest that something is being sold cheaply
the money that is available to an organization or person, or a plan of how it will be spent

sentences.english: She's not only a great dramatic actress but she's also very funny.
sentences.chinese: 她不仅是一位伟大的女戏剧演员，而且也很幽默。

detailed_translations.english: a woman who performs in a play or film

sentences.english: He slid open the door of the glass cabinet.
sentences.chinese: 他滑开玻璃柜的门。

detailed_translations.english: to move smoothly over a surface while continuing to touch it, or to make something move in this way
to move smoothly over a surface while continuing to touch it, or to make something move in this way
a large structure with steps leading to the top of a long sloping surface which children can slide down

sentences.english: He made funny faces to amuse the children.
sentences.chinese: 他做鬼脸逗孩子们开心。

sentences.english: The kids amused themselves playing hide-and-seek.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们玩捉迷藏玩。

sentences.english: Doing jigsaws would amuse Amy for hours on end.
sentences.chinese: 拼图能让埃米连续玩上几个小时。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone laugh or smile

sentences.english: I don’t find his jokes at all amusing .
sentences.chinese: 我觉得他的笑话一点都不好笑。

sentences.english: a highly amusing (=  very amusing  ) film
sentences.chinese: 非常有趣的电影

detailed_translations.english: funny and entertaining

sentences.english: The classic example is tossing a pancake so it flips over in mid-air.
sentences.chinese: 最经典的例子是摊薄饼的时候，颠勺时薄饼就会飞到半空中。

sentences.english: The package says baking and pancake mix, but the pancakes were not tasty without some major tweaking to the recipe.
sentences.chinese: 包装盒上说烤焙与薄饼面料混合，但没有添加一些主要调料，薄饼是不好吃的。

sentences.english: They are so-called “ pancake people ”, they no longer concentrate their energies on one area of interest, but instead choose to spread themselves thinly over a large area.
sentences.chinese: 他们就是所谓的“煎饼人”，他们不再将精力专注于某一个感兴趣的领域，而是让自己的关注点浅浅地散布在一个很大的范围。

detailed_translations.english: a thin flat round cake made from flour, milk, and eggs, that has been cooked in a flat pan and is eaten hot

sentences.english: She told the court she would give a full explanation of the prosecution's decision on Monday.
sentences.chinese: 她告诉法庭她将在星期一就控方的决定做出详尽的解释。

detailed_translations.english: a statement, fact, or situation that tells you why sth happened; a reason given for sth

sentences.english: She hired a detective to find out if her husband was having an affair.
sentences.chinese: 她雇了一个私人侦探调查她丈夫是否有外遇。

detailed_translations.english: a police officer whose job is to discover information about crimes and catch criminals

sentences.english: By the way, do you like the Sherlock Holmes in movies?
sentences.chinese: 顺便问一下，你喜欢电影中的夏洛克•福尔摩斯吗？

sentences.english: I’ve enlisted the help of Master Detective Sherlock Holmes to help guide us on our search.
sentences.chinese: 我已经列举出大侦探夏洛克福尔摩斯的箴言教导，引领我们向前进。

detailed_translations.chinese: 夏洛克.福尔摩斯（英国作家柯南.道尔作品中的名侦探）

sentences.english: the mountainous coast of Wales
sentences.chinese: 威尔士多山的海岸

sentences.english: mountainous waves
sentences.chinese: 如山的巨浪

detailed_translations.english: having many mountains

sentences.english: You don’t have to whisper, no one can hear us.
sentences.chinese: 你不必轻声轻语，没人听得到我们说话。

sentences.english: ‘I’ve missed you,’ he whispered in her ear.
sentences.chinese: “我想你了。”他在她耳边低语道。

detailed_translations.english: to speak or say something very quietly, using your breath rather than your voice
to speak or say something very quietly, using your breath rather than your voice

sentences.english: The refugees come across the border in vast numbers.
sentences.chinese: 大量难民涌过边境。

sentences.english: In the past five years, there has been a vast improvement in graduation rates.
sentences.chinese: 过去的五年内，毕业率大幅度提高。

detailed_translations.chinese: 巨大的， 大量的； 浩瀚的
detailed_translations.english: extremely large

sentences.english: Drums are basic to African rhythm.
sentences.chinese: 非洲音乐节奏少不了鼓。

sentences.english: complicated dance rhythms
sentences.chinese: 复杂的舞蹈节奏

sentences.english: the body’s natural rhythms
sentences.chinese: 人体的自然节律

detailed_translations.english: a regular repeated pattern of sounds or movements

sentences.english: What a mess!
sentences.chinese: 太乱了！

sentences.english: Sorry – the place is a bit of a mess .
sentences.chinese: 对不起——这里有些乱。

sentences.english: When I got home, the house was a complete mess .
sentences.chinese: 我回到家时，屋子里一片狼藉。

sentences.english: You can make cookies if you promise not to make a mess in the kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 如果你答应不把厨房搞得乱七八糟，你可以去做甜饼。

sentences.english: She hates mess.
sentences.chinese: 她讨厌到处乱糟糟的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 凌乱状态，混乱的局面；困境
detailed_translations.english: if there is a mess somewhere or a place is a mess, things there are dirty or not neatly arranged

detailed_translations.chinese: 弄糟， 弄脏， 搞乱
detailed_translations.english: to make something look untidy or dirty

sentences.english: He reacted angrily to the suggestion that he had lied.
sentences.chinese: 说他撒谎，他非常生气。

sentences.english: She reacted very badly (= was very upset ) when her parents split up.
sentences.chinese: 父母离婚的时候，她非常难过。
